alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 19 at 9:09PM CDT until April 19 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Cleveland County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 909 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over eastern Norman, or near Lake Thunderbird, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Eastern Norman, Pink, Lake Thunderbird, and Little Axe. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
